titleStmt.title: Unknown et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7576

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Daniel McCarty was Indicted at the April term of the Circuit Court faccused of Grand larceny, the testimony was verry meagre, but he was said to be a suspicious character from Philadelphia, while here he had formed the acquaintance of some very respectable persons, and raised their sympathy, he was in jail awaiting his trial -- and he told his friends that he desired to go home to see his family who was sick and he would return in time to stand his trial -- there upon one Mr James Fish went his Bail for Three hundred Dollars -- he McCarty went him but near returned, Mr Dupuy the Commonwealths attorney as well as evry one else has said that no doubt this was the best way to get rid of McCarty -- as it was very doubtful weather he could m have made out a case against him and the state and got rid of a susspicious character, Beleaving therfore that the state has already been benefeited by Mr Fish going on said McCartys Bond, as it is presumed we have got rid of a suspicious character that the
Law could not reach, we pray your Honour will remit at least a part of Mr Fishs Forfeiture

Respectfully
Many Citizens of Louisville beside the within subscribers

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Jas F Fish
$300
B. B

To His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky.

your Petitioners respectfully represent that in the Case of the Commonwealth against James, Daniel McCarty, on a charge of Felony, Mr Jas S. Fish, went on the bond of Said McCarty, for three hundred Dollars which bond has been forfeited, and owing to the Circumstances of the case we ask your Excellency to remit 60 pr cent or 180$ of said forefeiture,

Members of the Louisville Bar
R. H. Cockrell
Albert S. Willis
Asher G. Caruth
J. D. Harrington
N A Humber --
Ben M. Harney
R. M. J. Pound
Jeff. Brown
S. A Atchison
E. S. Worthington
E, F, Williams
John T, Harrington
Lytle Buchanan
George Sakermen
W. C. Mills
R. E. Sale
J. G. Harris
Rowan Buchanan
Saml Matlock J, P,
S. D. Holloway.
